title: PE Daily: CD&R Scores Big Gain on Sirius Sale | Private-Equity Approaches Trillion-Dollar Record | Goldman Sachs Gets China Green Light
text:

Now on to today's news...

Today's Top Stories

Clayton Dubilier & Rice has agreed to sell IT services integration provider Sirius Computer Solutions Inc. to CDW Group for $2.5 billion, a deal that stands to generate a gross return of three times the firm's investment in the company, Laura Kreutzer and Dave Sebastian write for WSJ Pro. The private-equity firm initially invested $414 million to acquire the company back in 2019.

Technology deals are driving what is shaping up to be a record year for M&A, one where so-called megadeals and club deals came roaring back and helped power what is expected to be the first $1 trillion deal year for private-equity firms, Dow Jones Newswires Maria Armental reports. As of the third quarter, private-equity firms had disclosed $868 billion in deals, topping the high-water mark of 2006-07 when PE firms collectively announced more than $750 billion in deals, according to Ernst & Young LLP.

Chinese regulators approved Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s application to take full ownership of a key local unit, another step in China's gradual opening of its financial system to major players from the U.S. and elsewhere, Quentin Webb writes for The Wall Street Journal. Goldman in December 2020 sought approval to increase its stake in a domestic Chinese business that it has co-owned since 2004. The New York-based bank said Sunday that China's financial markets regulator, the China Securities Regulatory Commission, had given its assent.

Big Number

$868 Billion

The volume of private-equity deals disclosed during the first three quarters of the year, a pace that puts the industry on track to top $1 trillion in deal volume for the first time, according to a report by Ernst & Young LLP.

Deals

Genesee Scientific provides life sciences consumables and equipment to the academic and biotech markets globally, including products like this mini centrifuge. Credit: Genesee Scientific

LLR Partners has backed Genesee Scientific Corp., which manufactures and distributes products for global life sciences markets, according to an emailed press release. The company's products include gloves, test tubes, pipet tips, reagents and various lab materials and equipment. Sean Patrick, a former executive at Life Technologies and Antylia Scientific, has joined Genesee Scientific as chief executive, the release stated.

Silver Lake has agreed to buy a 9.85% stake in European securities settlement company Euroclear Holding SA/NV from Intercontinental Exchange Inc., for €709 million, the equivalent of $822.3 million.

Publicly traded Blue Owl Capital said it has agreed to purchase sale-leaseback investor Oak Street Real Estate Capital LLC and its investment advisory business for $950 million in cash and Blue Owl common units. The equity shareholders of Chicago-based Oak Street also will be entitled to around $650 million in earnouts, provided the company hits certain performance thresholds, according to a press release.

Canadian pension investor Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec said it is taking a minority stake in Mexican medical diagnostics services company Grupo Diagnóstico Aries. In separate news, the Canadian investor is teaming with Westervelt Co., a Tuscaloosa, Ala.-based family-owned land-management and wood products company, to acquire more than 76,000 acres of U.S. pine timberland from Superior Pine Products and to create a partnership focused on sustainable timberland management.

BBH Capital Partners, the private-equity investment strategy of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co., said it has made a growth investment in the Granite Group alongside the Concord, N.H.-based company's management and founding Condron family. Granite Group offers plumbing, heating, cooling, water and propane supplies to residential and commercial contractors across New England.

Gryphon Investors said it has agreed to acquire Aliso Viejo, Calif.-based nutritional supplement services company Metagenics Inc. from Alticor Inc. The deal marks the fourth investment that Gryphon has made in partnership with Executive Advisor Steve LaMonte, who will become executive chairman of the Metagenics board, according to a press release.

European midmarket firm Equistone Partners Europe said it acquired a majority stake in gate and door manufacturer Gardengate from Lisbon-based private-equity firm Crest Capital Partners. Crest, which invests exclusively in Portuguese companies, will retain a minority stake in Gardengate.

The Beekman Group said it has recapitalized AutoManager LLC, which provides website-management tools and management software to independent auto dealers. The firm backed the deal out of Beekman Investment Partners IV LP, which closed at its $425 million hard cap in 2018.

Exits

Athene Holding, the publicly traded insurance affiliate of Apollo Global Management, is acquiring a majority stake in multi-channel mortgage lender Newfi from fellow private-equity firm Warburg Pincus. Apollo, which earlier this year said it would acquire the remaining stake in Athene that it does not already own, will manage Newfi, according to a news release.

Flex Ltd. has agreed to buy Anord Mardix, a company that provides power equipment and systems for data centers, for $540 million in cash, Matt Grossman writes for Dow Jones Newswires. Anord Mardix, which is expected to generate $360 million in revenue in 2021, is backed by private-equity firm Bertram Capital.

Informatica, the data-management company backed by private-equity firm Permira, is going public again, Luisa Beltra reports for sister publication Barron's. If the Redwood City, Calif.-based company hits the upper end of its proposed price range, the initial public offering could value the company at $8.8 billion.

Macquarie Capital has sold data analytics and artificial-intelligence technology provider Dovel Technologies to Guidehouse Inc., a technology company backed by Veritas Capital.

Funds

Ares Management Corp. said it has raised $5.1 billion for its second direct junior debt fund, surpassing the fund's $4 billion target. The firm plans to invest Ares Private Credit Solutions II primarily in directly originated second lien, mezzanine private high-yield debt and preferred equity of upper midmarket companies, according to a news release. The fund, which has already invested 20% of its money across nine companies, will also participate in common equity co-investments, the news release stated.

Midmarket investment firm Aterian Investment Partners has closed Aterian Investment Partners IV LP and a related parallel vehicle with more than $830 million, the firm said in a news release. The fund's final tally is more than double the $355 million that the firm collected for its previous effort back in 2018. Aterian plans to invest the new fund in companies generating $50 million to $750 million of revenue, according to the news release.

Everberg Capital, a midmarket firm focused on noncontrol investment stakes, has rounded up at least $118 million so far for Everberg Capital Partners II LP, which is seeking $350 million, according to a regulatory filing. Everberg typically invests $10 million to $100 million per transaction in both sponsored and unsponsored deals, according to its website.

People

Apollo Global Management Inc. said it has named Roger W. Ferguson Jr. as vice chairman of the firm, where he will advise the firm and its senior executives on strategic asset-management and retirement services initiatives, among other issues. Mr. Ferguson joins Apollo from retirement services provider TIAA, where he was president and chief executive.

Marvin Larbi-Yeboa has joined Bain Capital Private Equity as a managing director on the firm's technology investment team, where he will be based out of San Francisco. Mr. Larbi-Yeboa joins the firm from JPMorgan Chase & Co., where he was a managing director in the firm's mergers and acquisitions team, according to a press release.

Industry News

Foreign investment by businesses around the world surged in the first six months of 2021 as rich economies rebounded strongly from the effects of the pandemic, but fresh bets on manufacturing fell despite widespread signs that capacity isn't up to meeting resurgent demand, the Journal's Paul Hannon reports. The United Nations on Monday said businesses made new overseas investments valued at $852 billion in the first half of this year, an increase of $373 billion from the same period a year earlier. Of that total, three-quarters went to rich countries as businesses responding to the prospect of a speedy recovery driven by the rapid deployment of effective Covid-19 vaccines.

Investcorp is joining the growing list of investment firms targeting the insurance industry with news that it is launching Investcorp Insurance Solutions to provide investment-management services for insurers. The firm has tapped Todd Fonner as chief investment officer as part of the new unit's launch. Mr. Fonner has more than 28 years of industry experience, including most recently as senior managing director and CIO North America for Blackstone Inc.'s Blackstone Insurance Solutions unit.
